title: Ticket #613: MatchLog broken, D_MATCH was removed
description:
It appears the MatchLog has not been receiving any messages since the thread code was introduced. 

commit 1da9f4633762fe58e02cabd35f3112389844d8d4
Author: Todd Tannenbaum <tannenba@cs.wisc.edu>
Date:   Thu Sep 18 13:40:36 2008 -0500

    [#17] Initial commit adding threads.
    At this point, daemon core command handlers will start in a new
    thread and authentication will happen in parallel.

In this commit, D_MATCH is re-purposed to be D_THREADS. 

-#define D_MATCH                        (1<<25)
+#define D_THREADS              (1<<25)

The problem with this is the MatchLog (config param NEGOTIATOR_MATCH_LOG) has messages directed to it by virtue that they are emitted at the D_MATCH level.

The decision to change D_MATCH -> D_THREADS needs to be reversed. A better choice is D_MALLOC (unused), D_EXPR (unused, ref in submit), D_BANDWIDTH (unused, ref in dead code), D_NET_REMAP (unused, was GCB?), D_KEYBOARD (lightly used).
remarks:
2009-Jul-07 13:27:44 by matt:
Resolved by reintroducing D_MATCH where it had been removed.
check_ins: 2009-Jul-07 12:42   Check-in [15026]: Reintroduced D_MATCH (used D_UNUSED3), had been previously removed (#613) (By Matthew Farrellee )
creator: matt
